description: An elegant, medium-sized parrot with a long tail. They are typically bright green, but color mutations include blue, yellow, and white. Males are distinguished by a black and rose-colored ring around their neck.
temperament: Extremely intelligent and can be independent. They can make wonderful, affectionate pets if socialized from a young age, but can also go through a bluffing stage during adolescence.
loudness: Moderate to Loud. They have a loud, high-pitched, piercing call that they are not afraid to use, especially if they are seeking attention.
loudness_icon: <svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="w-12 h-12 text-yellow-500" viewBox="0 0 24 24" fill="currentColor" aria-hidden="true" role="img" aria-label="Moderate"><title>Moderate</title><path d="M7 9v6h4l5 5V4l-5 5H7zm9.5 2.5c0 .75-.38 1.41-.97 1.82v-3.64c.59.41.97 1.07.97 1.82zM14 8.25v7.5c1.18-.41 2-1.57 2-2.75s-.82-2.34-2-2.75z"></path></svg>
vocalization: Exceptional talkers. They are known for their incredibly clear, human-like voices and can develop an extensive vocabulary of words and phrases.
dietaryNeeds: A pelleted diet supplemented with a wide array of fresh fruits, vegetables, and greens. They are known for enjoying a varied diet.
healthPointers: Relatively healthy and can live 25-30 years. Susceptible to polyomavirus, psittacosis, and respiratory infections. Excellent fliers even with clipped wings.
housing: Can be suitable for apartment living if the owner is prepared for their potential noise. They need a tall cage to accommodate their long tail, minimum 24"W x 24"D x 36"H.
